Can anyone tell me what exactly is wrong with RFCs?

I mean except for the =
fact that you need consensus with a community that didn't pay massive amoun=
ts of money to suck up to other vendors and put a marketing stamp on their =
new products...

I'm on the Microsoft side of the world, and we suffer vast=
ly from a large amount of misinformation and REST branding. That really has=
n't helped us. Anything driven by marketing requirements or market pressure=
 rather than good practice documentation and community consensus is doomed =
to f*ck us painfully for years to come.

S.
